Lesson 1 ğŸ‘‰ Hello World!

In your IDE of choice, type this, and run the code:

print "Hello, world."
# Sorry, I had to.

What did you see come out?

âœ Python Notes

âœ… A variables stores data and gives it a name.
âœ… Two kinds of data are numbers and booleans.
âœ… In Python, white space is used to structure code.
âœ… The interpreter runs your code line by line.
âœ… # makes a single-line comment in Python.

Python Variables

can be
Numbers myAge = 37
or
Strings myName= "Ben"
or
Booleans isItSaturday = False

Whitespace

def spam():
    eggs = 12
    return eggs

print spam()
